answer: If you push something, it pushes back with the same force in the opposite direction
It means heavier objects need more force to speed up
It can make things move, stop, or change direction. Measured in Newtons (N)
Newton’s Second Law says that Force = Mass × Acceleration. It means heavier objects need more force to move or speed up
Impulse = Force × Time = Change in momentum. It's useful in situations like airbags or cricket catches to reduce force by increasing time
More mass means more inertia — that’s why heavier things are harder to move or stop
Everything around us — solids, liquids, and gases — is made of matter.
Heavier or faster objects have more momentum. It helps understand collisions and motion
Mass doesn’t change with location and is measured in kilograms (kg)
It happens when something speeds up, slows down, or changes direction. Measured in m/s².
Elastic: energy & momentum conserved. Inelastic: only momentum conserved. Perfectly inelastic: objects stick together.
